repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: English publishing firm, founded in the late 19th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and publishing agreements for many of their authors in the pre-World War I period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 3 series:

list.item: Series II: Cataloged Contracts and Receipts
Series III: Uncataloged Correspondence and Documents

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.persname: Vaizey, George de Horne, Mrs., b. 1857.
controlaccess.subject: Authors and publishers.
Books--Translations.
Clergy as authors.
Copyright--England.
English literature--19th century.
English literature--20th century.
Literature publishing--England.
Publishers and publishing--England.
Translations.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Hodder and Stoughton Records; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
